page.title: 07PEDESTRIANS IN TURNERS HILL
page.content: Crawley Down is fortunate that most of its roads have pavements or paths alongside. But in Turners Hill there are{few pavements}especially on the main roads. It is over{one mile}from the{village}to the{mobile home site}on the busy{B.2110.}There are over{200 {homes,}many{old people}and families with{children;}there are{few buses.}To get to the{post office}people have to walk along this road. The{County {Council}have{promised}a path but have given{no date}yet!{Lion Lane,}also with{no pavements,}is used by many people, as the{P.O.}and{butchers}are there. The{1983 Turners Hill School {traffic survey}counted{pedestrians}and {traffic}in Lion Lane and showed that over{800 people}and{400 vehicles}used it each day. The{new Parish Council {will continue to ask}for a{pavement}as the{Turners Hill Society}has done.
